intro: Aconitum × hamatum, commonly known as the hybrid monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, hood-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant features large, palmately lobed leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Aconitum × hamatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
